New Records: David Willey became the 14th England men’s player to reach 100 wickets in the ODI format.
Key Match Events: Jonny Bairstow and Joe Root hit half-centuries in the 337/9.
David Willey finished with figures of 3/56.
David Willey took both Pakistan openers' wickets with the new ball.
Moeen Ali saw Mohammad Rizwan coming, pulled back his length, and turned the ball back through the gate to clean up Pakistan’s number four for 36.
Adil Rashid removed Saud Shakeel for 29 and Shadab Khan for 4.
Agha Salman provided some resistance for Pakistan with 51 from 45 balls.
Shaheen Shah Afridi, Mohammad Wasim, and Haris Rauf connected some big late shots.
Jos Buttler decided to bat after winning the toss.
Ben Stokes hit four boundaries off Shaheen Afridi after the latter had dropped him.
Shaheen Afridi sent back Stokes for 84 and Root for 60.
Jos Buttler, Harry Brook, Moeen Ali, and David Willey all smashed sixes in an excellent display of late hitting.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan began proceedings knowing that they had the slimmest of chances of still reaching the semi-finals, requiring a win by an enormous margin to force a gargantuan swing on net run rate.
England captain Jos Buttler decided to bat after winning the toss.
Babar Azam added that they'd try to make the best of the circumstances.
Post-Match Reflections: David Willey is the Aramco #POTM in his final international game after an impressive showing with the ball.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England secured a guaranteed top-eight finish that cements the team’s qualification for the next Champions Trophy.
England ended their stuttering campaign on a relative high.
